FuncDef:
The remote-attestation port-segment command configures a port range used to establish TCP connections for remote attestation.
The undo remote-attestation port-segment command deletes a port range used to establish TCP connections for remote attestation.
By default, no port range is configured to establish TCP connections for remote attestation.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start port number in a port range.
The value is an integer ranging from 1025 to 65535. The default value is 12443.

Specifies the number of ports in a port range.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4. The default value is 2.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After remote attestation is configured, to configure a port range used to establish TCP connections between a device and a remote attestation server, run the remote-attestation port-segment command on the device.
The port number ranges from port to port + countnum - 1.
